title: Design Museum, London
content:
Rather disappointed to see that this

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105041741im_/http:/typophile.com/files/web013_5348.jpg)
 was the only piece of [Kinneir](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105041741/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Kinneir) and [Calvert](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105041741/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Calvert)'s work on display in the [Designing Modern Britain](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105041741/http:/www.designmuseum.org/exhibitions/current-exhibitions/designing-modern-britain) exhibitiom, and I think that changed on Sunday.

There was also a London Underground display with some some posters, an upholstery swatch and a repro platform seat with integral enamelled roundel. And a small case with some [Gill](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105041741/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Gill) and [Monotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105041741/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Monotype) material.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105041741im_/http:/typophile.com/files/web009_4720.jpg)

The [Alan Fletcher](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105041741/http:/www.designmuseum.org/exhibitions/current-exhibitions/alanfletcher) exhibition downstairs was (to my mind, and my wife agrees with me) much better. Some pictures later.
author: Richard Hards

comments.content: Please do share. I'm a huge fan of Alan Fletcher's work.
